input_data.title: Black Monday
input_data.overview: Travel back to October 19, 1987 – aka Black Monday, the worst stock market crash in Wall Street history – this is the story of how a group of outsiders took on the blue-blood, old-boys club of Wall Street and ended up crashing the world’s largest financial system, a Lamborghini limousine, Don Henley’s birthday party and the glass ceiling.

response.analytical_summary: Black Monday is a darkly comedic crime series that reimagines the events leading up to the infamous 1987 stock market crash. The show follows a group of eccentric outsiders as they navigate the cutthroat world of Wall Street, challenging the established order and inadvertently triggering a catastrophic financial collapse. With a blend of sharp wit, outrageous characters, and a satirical take on the excesses of the 1980s, the series offers a fast-paced and irreverent exploration of greed, ambition, and the fragility of the financial system. It's a comedic thriller that balances high-stakes drama with absurd humor.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins in 1987, introducing Don Forten, a brilliant but volatile stockbroker, and his team, who are desperate to prove themselves in the male-dominated world of Wall Street. They operate outside the traditional power structures, often employing unorthodox and ethically questionable tactics to generate profits. As the team’s success grows, they attract the attention of powerful figures who seek to exploit their abilities. The escalating tensions between the team and the established order culminate in a series of increasingly risky maneuvers, pushing the market closer and closer to the brink. A complex web of betrayals and power struggles unfolds, with characters vying for control and manipulating events to their advantage. Ultimately, a combination of reckless ambition, flawed judgment, and unforeseen circumstances leads to the infamous Black Monday crash, leaving a trail of financial ruin and shattered reputations. The series explores the aftermath of the crash, revealing the long-term consequences for the characters and the broader financial landscape.
response.keyword_sentence: Black Monday is a darkly comic financial thriller set on Wall Street in the 1980s, satirizing corporate greed and ambition through the story of a volatile team who inadvertently trigger a devastating stock market crash.
